Emoji.alert.clipboard: The Current Number and Current Text have been copied to the 📋.
Emoji.alert.clipboard.local: The Current Number and Current Text have been copied to the local 📋.
Emoji.alert.firstRun:
App Framework is a starting point for shortcut developers to create applications in Shortcuts. It features:

• Preferences
• Localization
• Application Loop
• vCard Menus
• Pseudo-Global Variables
• Pseudo-Local Variables
• Pseudo-Classes
• Pseudo-Functions

App Framework has plenty of comments to help you understand how the framework operates. You’ll be up and running writing your own shortcut applications in no time!
Emoji.alert.firstRun2: Turn on "Show Debugging Information" in Settings to display alerts during program execution, in and out of the main application loop.
Emoji.alert.update: This shortcut will now close and open Safari to the shortcut's page on RoutineHub.co. Compare the version number below with that on RoutineHub and update if necessary.
Emoji.alert.update.title: Check for App Framework Updates
Emoji.alert.welcome:
App Framework is a starting point for creating shortcut applications with:

Preferences, localization, application loop, vCard menus, global variables, local variables, classes, functions, and more

https://tow.com/shortcuts/framework/

By Adam Tow • tow.com • @atow
Emoji.debug.input.empty:
Shortcut Input EMPTY

App Loop -> Application.menus -> Application.welcome
Emoji.debug.input.notEmpty:
Shortcut Input NOT EMPTY:

App Loop -> Application.menus -> Program.start
